ProfileInformation.Author: notBillJames
ProfileInformation.Description:
For the Honeycomb Alpha/Bravo

Alpha setup is as follows:

MASTER ALT: BAT 1 & 2

MASTER BAT: BAT 3

AVIONICS BUS1: CONNECT EXTERNAL POWER

AVIONICS BUS 2: START APU

All the lights toggles do what you'd expect, with some custom logic for the taxi & landing lights

  • if landing lights are OFF, turning on the taxi lights will set the runway turnoff lights to ON and taxi lights to TAXI

  • if landing lights are ON, turning on the taxi lights will set the runway turnoff lights to ON and taxi lights to TO

  • if landing taxi lights are ON, turning on the landing lights will set the taxi lights to TO

Everything on the yoke (except the big red button) I have bound to VJOY buttons which are bound in my sim for camera controls, trim, vpilot, etc.

BRAVO setup is as follows:

The rocker switches from left to right go:

  • Parking Brake

  • Wing Anti-Ice

  • Engine Anti-Ice

  • Fuel Pumps

  • APU Bleed

  • Engine One Start Button

  • Engine Two Start Button

The Gear does the gear, 20s after gear up it puts it into off

The flaps toggle controls the dome light brightness

I use the boeing throttles, speedbrake lever, and flaps handle. The speedbrake lever has the very front set to arm spoilers, a neutral zone behind that, and then the spoilers axis behind that

For throttle controls, in the airplane I set the EFB throttle axis to no reversers. Then in SPAD.next it is setup for you to pull the reverse levers, which toggles the reversers, then push the throttles to full forward for full reverse.

The autopilot is fairly simple. Push the button quickly and it will pull the associated knob, push the button for a long time and it will push the associated knob. This applies for the ALT, and IAS buttons.

HDG BUTTON engages HDG SEL in the Plane

NAV BUTTON engages NAV in the plane

APR button (short) engages LAND in the plane

APR button (long) engages V/L in the plane

REV button engages PROFILE in the plane

VS button engages VS

Press the AP button quickly, it engages AP one.

Press the AP button longer, it engages AP two.
